Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: SMALL BODY RADAR SHAPE MODELS V2.0
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Neese, C., Ed. Small Body Radar Shape Models V2.0. EAR-A-5-DDR-RADARSHAPE-MODELS-V2.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 2004.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: Radar-based shape models of small solar system bodies
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set contains radar-based shape models for small solar system bodies, prepared by various authors.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= This data set contains radar-based shape models for small solar system bodies, generated by the method developed by Scott Hudson. (The Peter Thomas shape models, based on optical data, are included in a separate data set, EAR-A-5-DDR-SHAPE-MODELS-V2.0.)
The current version of this data set contains shape models for the following asteroids: 216 Kleopatra, 1620 Geographos, 2063 Bacchus, 4197 Toutatis (low and high resolution models), 4769 Castalia, 6489 Golevka, 1998 KY26, ASTEROID 52760 (1998 ML14), and 25143 Itokawa.
Parameters ========== The polyhedral shape models are specified by the coordinates of the vertices of the polyhedron in conjunction with the linkages of the vertices into triangular facets. These files provide sufficient information for use in visualization applications such as POVray and DXF. The origin of the models is the center of mass, and the axes are the principal axes. For all the models except Toutatis, the z- axis is the spin vector or north pole. For Toutatis, the z-axis is the long axis. Toutatis is in a long-axis non-principal-axis rotation state.
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Review ====== This data set underwent external peer review on May 20, 2004.
